popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning

Class FNPTask3Pool

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.NumberPartitioning.FNPTask3Pool

  • class FNPTask3Pool
extends java.lang.Object
    implements a stack-based thread-local pool of FNPTask3 objects. In this way, there will be no need for invoking the new operator within the running threads requiring such objects, unless a thread at some point runs out of space in its thread-local pool. Not part of the public API.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2014-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) static FNPTask3 getObject(int n)
      factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one.
      private FNPTask3 getObjectFromPool()
      return an managed "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
      (package private) int getVectorsLength()
      return the length of the vectors in this pool.
      (package private) void initialize()
      method is only called from FNPTask3ThreadLocalPools right after this object is constructed to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.
      (package private) void returnObjectToPool(FNPTask3 ind)
      returns the argument to this pool, IFF it belongs to this pool.
      (package private) static void setPoolSize(int num)
      sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FNPTask3Pool

        public FNPTask3Pool(int n)
        sole constructor. Creates _NUMOBJS "empty" FNPTask3 objects.
        Parameters:
        n - int the fixed size of the long array of each object in the pool.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        static FNPTask3 getObject(int n)
        factory object creation method, first tries to return a managed object from the pool, and if it cannot find one, creates a new (unmanaged) one. The returned object, always has its data member correctly set.
        Parameters:
        n - int array size
        Returns:
        FNPTask3

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        method is only called from FNPTask3ThreadLocalPools right after this object is constructed to avoid escaping "this" in the constructor.

      • returnObjectToPool

        void returnObjectToPool(FNPTask3 ind)
        returns the argument to this pool, IFF it belongs to this pool.
        Parameters:
        ind - FNPTask3

      • getVectorsLength

        int getVectorsLength()
        return the length of the vectors in this pool.
        Returns:
        int

      • getObjectFromPool

        private FNPTask3 getObjectFromPool()
        return an managed "free" object from the pool, or null if it cannot find one.
        Returns:
        FNPTask

      • setPoolSize

        static void setPoolSize(int num)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        sets the number of objects in the thread-local pools to the size specified. Must only be called once, before any pool is actually constructed (should only be called from the FNPTask3ThreadLocalPools class).
        Parameters:
        num - int
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is ≤ 0
